header.aside: One of the easiest & quickest protein cookie recipes in the world! These moist and delicious soft-baked chocolate chip protein cookies are perfect for dunking in coffee.

section.p:
You know that mid-afternoon slump where you just crave caffeine and sugar? Well, that combined with a French man vending scrumptious pastries on every corner as they do here in southern France is hard fight to win. Unless, of course, you have an equally scrumptious, healthy alternative with which to satisfy your sweet tooth! And what better than a soft-baked, chocolate chip protein cookie? All it takes is 5 ingredients to make delicious, high-protein, low-fat, low-carb, lactose- and gluten-free cookies (then what's in them?). Better yet, it's a Lila, Chop! recipe for beginners.
Protein cookies with chocolate chunks

section.p: As you can see, the recipe works by using the nut-butter mix combined with protein powder to substitute flour, eggs, and butter, and the fruit-concentrate syrup instead of sugar. That's how you make a simple, clean, gluten/lactose/sugar-free cookie that's high in protein and still wonderfully tasty. Finally, the secret behind the soft-baked texture and consistency? Casein protein powder, which binds to liquid and reacts to heat in such a way that it retains its airy moistness. I used both Truenutrition Micellar Casein and Myprotein Micellar Casein protein powder, vanilla , and highly recommend baking with these powders.

tr.td: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl.
Roll into 4 balls and place on a baking paper-lined oven tray.
Bake at 160'C (320'F) and check after 10 minutes to make sure they don't overcook.
Enjoy with or without fresh strawberries & coffee!

section.p: This recipe was adapted from Proteinpow's recipe A Single-Serving Protein Cookie Pie by Anna Sward, who used less milk and pea protein powder instead of casein, which gives a denser and firmer cookie consistency. If you want to try it with pea protein powder (for vegan protein cookies), I recommend Myprotein pea protein isolate .
A peanut butter version of this gorgeous soft-baked chocolate-chip protein cookie recipe is coming soon to Lila, Chop!.
